snippet: Investors bought the mortgage company’s stock during a period when regulators found the firm had overstated its income.
abstract: Fannie Mae and its former auditor KPMG agree to pay $153 million to investors who purchased Fannie's stock from 2001 to 2004 during period when regulator for the government-sponsored mortgage finance company determined it had overstated income and violated generally accepted accounting principles.
lead_paragraph: Investors bought the mortgage company’s stock during a period when regulators found the firm had overstated its income.

headline.seo: Fannie Mae and KPMG to Pay Investors $153 Million
headline.main: Investors Get a Settlement by Fannie Mae
headline.print_headline: Investors Get A Settlement By Fannie Mae
